result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah J. King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to all other sentences

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two, and if not, perform 10 hours community service. Obtain HSEC or GED.

Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent written authorization.
No entry into any store without advanced written authorization of the agent.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
*AMENDED- eligible for ERP

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to all other sentences

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Letter to Judge Jacobson from Atty. Kennedy - Court approves dft eligible for ERP and Judgments of Conviction to be modified - includes 14CF619, 14CM1161, 14CM1162 & 14CM1349
and Acknowledgement of Ineligible Voting

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:03 AM 
INCLUDES 14CF619, 14CM1161, 14CM1162, AND 14CM1349. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Robin Kennedy. 
Parties state they have reviewed PSI and there are no additions/corrections. VRCW. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 14CF619: Ct. 1>>4 years imprisonment - 2 years IC and 2 years ES - with 139 days credit and to run consecutive to all others sentences. 
In 14CM1161: Ct. 1>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year - imposed and STAYED for 3 years probation. 
In 14CM1162: Ct. 1>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year - imposed and STAYED for 3 years probation. 
In 14CM1349: Ct. 1>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year - imposed and STAYED for 3 years probation. 
                       : Ct. 2>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year - imposed and STAYED for 3 years probation. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES in 14CF619: $586.20 Restitution to Target; AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent written authorization; no entry into any store without advanced written authorization of the agent; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; obtain HSED or GED; payment of court costs. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDTIONS OF PROBATION on ALL MISD. FILES: AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent written authorization; no entry into any store without advanced written authorization of the agent; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; obtain HSED or GED; payment of court costs. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITION OF PROBATION in 14CM1161: $478.18 restitution to Quality Foods IGA in Schofield. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITION OF PROBATION in 14CM1162: $311.17 restitution to County Market; $253.07 restitution to Shopko; $114.30 restitution to Walmart. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITION OF PROBATION in 14CM1349: $32.65 restitution to Pick N Save. 

COURT notes if prison sentences are imposed in misdemeanor files they are to run CONSECUTIVE to each other. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit in misd. files. 
COURT finds the def is NOT eligible for CIP or SAP. 
COURT notes the repeater enhancers were taken into account in determining length of sentences. 

OTR: 9:42 am BOTR: 9:45 am 
COURT questions parties regarding keeping PSI. State and Atty Kennedy will keep PSI. COURT advises parties to keep them confidential. 
Adj: 9:46 am
includes 14CF619, 14CM1161, 14CM1162, 14CM1349 (sealed) - stj
Sentencing hearing on December 10, 2014 at 08:40 am.
Robin Kennedy

In 14CM1162: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CM1349: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                       : Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CF619: Ct. 1 (Felony Retail Theft/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: PSI to be completed within 60 days of today's date. 
Sentencing Hearing set for December 12, 2014 at 3pm in Br. 3.
